race.name: RADL GRVL
race.tagline: Adelaide Hills adventure—130km of rolling Australian bush, 2,500m elevation, South Australia gravel.

terrain.surface: 85% gravel, 15% dirt roads. Adelaide Hills—rolling Australian bush terrain. 2,500 m over 130 km cumulative elevation. Technical rating: 3/5.

biased_opinion.summary: RADL GRVL is Adelaide Hills adventure—130 km, 2,500 m elevation. Founded ~2020. 85% gravel, 15% dirt. Rolling Australian bush terrain. 400-600 riders. Adelaide city (good airport access). April autumn conditions (12-22°C). Affordable entry (A$150-A$200 / $100-$135). If you want Australian gravel adventure with good logistics, this is it. If you want local/domestic race, skip it. International destination race.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: RADL GRVL is Australian bush gravel. 130 km, 2,500 m, Adelaide Hills. If you want Australian gravel destination race with good logistics and affordable entry, this is it. If you want local/domestic, skip it. International travel required but Adelaide access is easy.

logistics.travel_summary: Fly to Adelaide (ADL). Rental car or shuttle (30 km, 30-minute drive). Adelaide city lodging—book early. Day-before packet pickup. Race April.
logistics.food_options: Aid stations on course. Post-race party in Adelaide.

course_description.character: 130 km, 2,500 m. 85% gravel, 15% dirt. Adelaide Hills—rolling Australian bush. Technical rating: 3/5.

suffering_zones.name: Throughout: Adelaide Hills Rolling Terrain
suffering_zones.description: Rolling Australian bush. 2,500 m cumulative elevation. Relentless.
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: Pace conservatively. Low gears. Cumulative elevation adds up. 130 km long.

suffering_zones.name: Throughout: Chunky Australian Gravel
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: 35-40mm tubeless. Steady pace. Chunky but not technical.

course_description.signature_challenge: 130 km + 2,500 m cumulative elevation. Rolling Australian bush.

history.origin_story: RADL GRVL founded ~2020. Adelaide Hills gravel. 130 km, 400-600 riders. South Australia. Growing Australian gravel scene.
history.reputation: Australian gravel scene. Adelaide Hills. Well-organized. International destination.
